alert.note: Alert for McPherson; Rice (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 9:11AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western McPherson and northeastern Rice Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 911 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Little River, or 13 miles northeast of Lyons, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mcpherson, Little River, Windom and Mcpherson Airport. This includes Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 66 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
